intro: Epitrachys tenuiloba, commonly known as the slender leaf epitrachys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in dry environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
